kszucs commented on pull request #5563: ARROW-2863: [Python] Add context manager APIs to RecordBatch*Writer/Reader classes
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5563#discussion_r330531528
 
 

 ##########
 File path: python/pyarrow/ipc.py
 ##########
 @@ -56,9 +56,16 @@ class RecordBatchStreamReader(lib._RecordBatchStreamReader, _ReadPandasOption):
     source : bytes/buffer-like, pyarrow.NativeFile, or file-like Python object
         Either an in-memory buffer, or a readable file object
     """
+
     def __init__(self, source):
         self._open(source)
 
+    def __enter__(self):
+        return self
+
+    def __exit__(self, exc_type, exc_value, traceback):
+        pass
 
 Review comment:
   Seems like we don't have a close method on the readers, but I've added it for convenience.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

kszucs commented on issue #5563: ARROW-2863: [Python] Add context manager APIs to RecordBatch*Writer/Reader classes
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5563#issuecomment-537853455
 
 
   @pitrou `_open()` is called from the python side constructors, so if we move the context manager to the cython classes we cannot be sure whether the objects is opened, or we should open it from `__enter__`.

jorisvandenbossche commented on issue #5563: ARROW-2863: [Python] Add context manager APIs to RecordBatch*Writer/Reader classes
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5563#issuecomment-538872221
 
 
   The failures seem to be caused by a hanging flight test: `test_do_put_independent_read_write` doesn't finish within 10 or 20 min (and it's the same on travis, appveyor and ursabot)
   
   Looking in that test, it is using a FlightStreamWriter object as a context manager, which subclasses `_CRecordBatchWriter`, and that base class is the one where you removed the `__enter__` and `__exit__` methods.
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org
